data.title: Improve Project Structure

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

The current project folder structure in this repository has grown organically over the years and isn't ideal for new users. It should be re-organized.
### Analysis
- This needs to happen before [branching off v3.0](https://github.com/AdamsLair/duality/milestone/6), as it will make merges pretty much impossible.
- It will invalidate all previous repository links from the forum, since they don't use versioned links, but head links.
  - [Using commit-links](http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?f=4&t=934) should prevent this in the future.
- It will also screw up file history, since git usually stops tracking after a rename / move.
  - Investigate whether it would make sense to [perform renames and move operations with git directly](https://git-scm.com/docs/git-mv).
  - Potentially not though, as the git move seems to be [a shortcut](https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-821?focusedCommentId=496696&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-496696) for a regular move with git add and git remove.
- Probably still worth it, as a long-term investment.
- Reduce top-level folders to a categorizing minimum.
  - **Source**: Contains the actual source code for all of Duality itself, as well as standard plugins.
  - **Build**: Contains build tool binaries, scripts and specs for building NuGet packages, Documentation, etc.
  - **Tools**: Containts source code for build tools, VS debugger integration, etc.
  - **.github**: GitHub-specific config files.
  - That's it? All else should be the regular and / or required top-level files.
- Every top-level folder except "Build" should be self-contained, so deleting all others will leave them unaffected.
- The "Source" folder should also be restructured internally:
  - Core (including primitives and tests)
  - Editor (including updater and tests)
  - Launcher
  - Plugins, Plugins/Tilemaps, Plugins/EditorModules, ...
  - Platform, Platform/Net45, ...
  - Samples, ...
  - Remove secondary solutions files and get back to the single "Duality.sln" one that contains everything. Make sure its internal folder structure matches the actual folder structure.
- Update `appveyor.yml`, potentially scripts.
- Update nightly build config file (relative paths).
- Do a test-merge into release to see if AppVeyor can do a complete build.
- Update Wiki pages with regard to source code links (Find / Replace All?)

data.title: Exception Caused by Serializer Finalizer

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
### Summary

When executing the finalizer of a Serializer that is based on a non-closing stream wrapper, an Exception will be thrown if the file stream has already been closed before.
### How to reproduce
- In the real-world use case that is described [here](http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?p=5640#p5640), the bug occurs non-deterministically.
- It can, however, be reproduced by explicitly creating a serializer, using it on a wrapped stream, disposing the underlying stream and then waiting for the serializer to be garbage-collected.
### Analysis
- Investigate a potential Serializer leak, since it isn't disposed, but collected.
- Investigate a potential bug in the finalizer implementation of Serializer.
- Investigate desired behavior when invoking functionality on a wrapper stream when the wrapped stream is disposed. However, it is likely that throwing an `ObjectDisposedException` is the preferable behavior and the bug occurs because of using the wrapper in a bad / an unsafe way.
### Attachments
- [Forum posting with details](http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?p=5640#p5640)
- Callstack:

```
   at System.IO.__Error.FileNotOpen()\r\n   at System.IO.FileStream.Flush(Boolean flushToDisk)\r\n   at Duality.IO.NonClosingStreamWrapper.Flush() in c:\\projects\\duality\\Duality\\IO\\Streams\\NonClosingStreamWrapper.cs:line 79\r\n   at Duality.Serialization.BinarySerializer.OnTargetStreamChanged(Stream oldStream, Stream newStream) in c:\\projects\\duality\\Duality\\Serialization\\BinarySerializer.cs:line 175\r\n   at Duality.Serialization.Serializer.set_TargetStream(Stream value) in c:\\projects\\duality\\Duality\\Serialization\\Serializer.cs:line 253\r\n   at Duality.Serialization.Serializer.Finalize() in c:\\projects\\duality\\Duality\\Serialization\\Serializer.cs:line 283
```

![tktaonn](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14859411/18508698/7ec4bdc2-7a75-11e6-8497-460fa85e344f.png)

data.title: Remove Resource.OnSaved / OnSaving Methods

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
### Summary

The Resource class provides virtual `OnSaving` / `OnSaved` handler methods that are only invoked when serializing via Resource API, but not when using a serializer explicitly. Long-term, behavior between the two options should be synced.
### Workaround
- Use `Resource.Save` API for serializing Resources, rather than serializer API.
### Analysis
- The only Resource that makes use of these handlers is the `Scene`.
- The required special behavior in `Scene` could potentially be achieved by providing an `ISerializeExplicit` implementation for its `GameObjectManager`.
- To fully synchronize behavior across APIs, dynamically adding and removing field blockers would also need to be moved elsewhere.
- Alternatively, let the Resource base class implement `ISerializeExplicit` (or similar?) and provide its implementation via virtual methods, while performing the previous handler logic in there. However, this would require the explicit serialization to be transparent, or at least have a way to fall back to 100% default behavior. Highly arguable for now, resort to other options.
### Attachments
- Related [forum thread](http://forum.adamslair.net/viewtopic.php?f=4&t=930).

data.title: Engine throws a deserialization exception when attempting to load a Prefab that uses a non-existent Component class

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
I have a prefab that holds a component that doesn't exist anymore.
So the editor throws an error, that the component wasn't found.
Thats understandable, but the engine  throws also this exception:

```
[Core] Error:           Error reading object: NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
CallStack:
   at Duality.Log.Type(TypeInfo type) in c:\projects\duality\Duality\Utility\Log\Log.cs:line 319
   at Duality.Serialization.XmlSerializer.ReadMemberInfo(XElement element, ObjectHeader header) in c:\projects\duality\Duality\Serialization\XmlSerializer.cs:line 675
   at Duality.Serialization.XmlSerializer.ReadObjectBody(XElement element, ObjectHeader header) in c:\projects\duality\Duality\Serialization\XmlSerializer.cs:line 464
   at Duality.Serialization.XmlSerializer.ReadObjectData(XElement element) in c:\projects\duality\Duality\Serialization\XmlSerializer.cs:line 444
[Core] Warning:         Missing or Disposed Component in GameObject 'GameObject "Prophet"'. This should never happen and is likely the cause of malformed data
```

data.title: Extract Rendering Setup From Camera

milestone.title: v3.0
milestone.description: Everything that will be part of the major v3.0 Duality release.

data.body:
### Summary

Right now, every Camera instance has its own configuration of rendering passes. The only viable way to share them among different Cameras is using a Prefab, which may have side effects that are not intended or wanted by the user. Sharing rendering setups is the default case, so it should be easy and straight-forward.
### Workaround
- Create a Camera Prefab and use it to share the rendering setup.
### Analysis
- A new Resource type could be created to store the rendering setup information, with each Camera referencing it.
- All Camera-related information in a rendering pass should be expressed as a relative value, so it scales according to each using camera's settings.
- When no Resource is referenced, a default setup should be used. Also introduce the default rendering setup to the available default resources.
- For cases where a non-shared / unique / custom rendering setup is used, it shouldn't be too bad to just create another rendering setup resource.

data.title: Fix Exception When Switching Tile Palette Tileset From Big to Small

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
#### Summary

When changing the Tileset that is used in the Tile Palette to one that contains fewer tiles than the current tile selection includes, an Exception will be thrown.
#### How to Reproduce
1. Create two Tilesets, one with more tiles than the other.
2. Open the Tile Palette or switch into Tilemap Editor mode.
3. Select the last few tiles in the bigger Tileset.
4. Select the smaller Tileset.

data.title: Fix Exception When Resolving Tilemap Indices After Switching Its Tileset

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
#### Summary

When changing the Tileset that is used by a Tilemap to one that contains fewer tiles, an Exception will be thrown when loading the Scene next time. This will also lead to the editor entering an inconsistent state and potential data loss.
#### How to reproduce
1. Create two Tilesets, one with more tiles than the other.
2. Create a new Tilemap with the larger Tileset.
3. Fill it with the highest index tile.
4. Replace the Tilemap's Tileset with the smaller one.
5. Save the current Scene.
6. Close the editor and open the Scene.
#### Analysis
- Approach A: Sanitizing Tilemap indices.
  - This is a destructive operation.
  - Switching the Tileset twice will result in destroying the Tilemaps former content above a certain tile index.
- Approach B: Doing range checks and early-out.
  - This is a non-destructive way.
  - No code (user and core) should expect a Tile's base index to be valid at all times. All code needs to check.
  - A Tile's index could actually be fixed during resolve, since the index is a non-persistent / temporary value.
- Side note: When switching a Tilemap's Tileset, does it already re-resolve all of its tiles? Because that should be done in any case.

data.title: Can't delete a Component if the GameObject misses one of its RequiredComponent

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
#### Summary

Basically what title says
#### How to reproduce [Bugs]
- Create a Component A
- Add Component A to a GameObject
- Create Component B
- Add B as RequiredComponent for A
- You can't delete A as long as you don't add B to the GameObject, 
  EDIT : you must do it in the object inspector
#### Workaround [Bugs]
- Add missing RequiredComponent to the GameObject
- EDIT : Right-click + delete in the scene view works.

data.title: Remember the previous opened scene and switch to it when exiting the sandbox-mode

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
#### Summary

You want to switch to the the next scene (level) by code and you are currently in the sandbox mode, you have to switch to the previous scene (level) in the editor, because the editor stays at the new loaded scene even if you exist the sandbox-mode.
#### Analysis
- The editor have to remember the previous opened scenes.

data.title: Remove Camera Rotation in CamView

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
#### Summary

When holding the right mouse button, the CamView will rotate its camera. In the five years of developing Duality and using it to build various games and prototypes, I have never once used this, nor seen anyone using this. At the same time, rotation is confusing and difficult to undo. Consider removing CamView camera rotation entirely.

data.title: Tilesets Should be Able to Generate Missing AutoTiles

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
#### Summary

The AutoTile feature that is introduced by issue #281 only works with tiles that already exist in the source tileset. This requires a significant effort on the art side (or requires additional tooling), since all 47 base permutations of the tile need to be done manually. Introduce an option to let each AutoTile layer generate these permutations from the available tiles.
#### Analysis
- A regular AutoTile layout splits a tile into four sub-tiles. By recombining the existing sub-tiles, remaining base permutations can be created easily.
- `Tileset.TileCount` needs to be revisited to account for constructed tiles. There needs to be one count with only the source tiles considered, and another with really all of them considered.
- For each surroundings / AutoTile index, there is a mapping to a valid tile index. No exceptions. If there is none for a given setup, use a suitable fallback instead.
- When constructing missing tiles from existing ones, derive tile info from source tiles: Height, vertical / flat should be the same, collision needs to be pieced together.
- Auto-generated tiles should not show up anywhere the user directly interacts with or reviews a Tileset.
#### Attachments

Test Tileset for AutoTile behavior: 

![autotiletest](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/14859411/17711191/ba56105c-63f0-11e6-96a1-09f4a518be56.png)

data.title: Introduce a Way to Selectively Keep Changes When Exiting Sandbox Mode

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
It would be helpful if you could save modified values of an component when the the game is in the sandbox mode.

The problem is that the changes don't get saved when you exit the sandbox mode.

**My suggestion:**
- A new entry in the menustrip called e.g. "Save changes". It's visible when the sandbox mode is active.

![dualityeditor_2016-08-14_13-19-41](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6233308/17648775/d130c324-6221-11e6-985a-40feea3fad5d.png)

data.title: Auto-Establish Component References in the Same GameObject

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.title: Improve Sample Project Handling in VersionUpdater Tool

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
#### Summary

The VersionUpdater currently handles sample projects like any other, when in fact there are some special cases that should be considered.
#### Workaround
- To bump sample project versions, insert some fake changes (such as csproj spaces in comment sections) to trigger the tool.
- For false-positive changes in nested cases, just manually skip the update for plugins that in fact haven't changed.
#### Analysis
- A sample project should be updated / bumped whenever a non-standard dependency is updated. Otherwise, downloading the sample will (correctly!) install out-of-date dependencies.
- When checking for project changes, ignore changes in nested folders, such as a sample nested inside its core plugin base folder (DynamicLighting, Tilemaps).

data.title: Introduce Custom Tileset Data Tags

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
#### Summary

Right now, there is no builtin way that allows users to specify additional data layers for a Tileset. It would be nice if there was a convenient was to specify data tags for groups of tiles.
#### Workaround
- Users can already specify additional data in an array and index it using the tile index.
- This, however, is not very usable.
#### Analysis
- Add an additional `TilesetEditorMode` where any number of custom data layers can be specified.
- Each layer, when selected, allows the user to specify a tag object in the Object Inspector.
- For each layer, the tileset view allows to specify all the tiles that will be tagged.
- The `TilesetCompiler` will generate one output layer for each input layer.
- A `Tileset` should specify API for conveniently retrieving tags for a tile, or all tiles of a certain tag layer.
- _Note:_ It might be a good idea to specify that target API first in this case.

data.title: IndexOutOfRangeException in TileMap grid

milestone.title: General
milestone.description: Improving the existing functionality of Duality without creating whole new modules or systems.

data.body:
I've got an IndexOutOfRangeException by painting some tiles:

```
[Edit] Error:   An error occurred: IndexOutOfRangeException: Index was outside the bounds of the array.
```
